Bash(gh pr create --title "feat: add search scope functionality for keys/values/all filtering" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary

- Add comprehensive search scope functionality allowing users to search specifically in keys, values, or all content
- Implement Tab key cycling through search scopes: All â†’ Keys â†’ Values â†’ All
- Add visual scope indicator in SearchBar component with `[All]`, `[Keys]`, `[Values]` display
- Extend search logic with `searchInJsonWithScope` for targeted filtering
- Maintain full backward compatibility with existing search behavior

## Key Features

### Search Scope Types
- **All**: Search in entire JSON content (default, existing behavior)
- **Keys**: Search only in JSON property names/keys
- **Values**: Search only in JSON property values

### User Interface
- Search scope indicator displayed on right side of search bar
- Current scope highlighted with blue background when "All" is selected
- Updated help text includes "Tab: scope" instruction

### Keyboard Controls
- **Tab**: Cycle through search scopes in both search input mode and navigation mode
- Works seamlessly with existing keyboard shortcuts (s, n, N, Enter, Esc)

### Technical Implementation
- `SearchScope` type: `"all" | "keys" | "values"`
- Extended `SearchState` interface with `searchScope` property
- New `searchInJsonWithScope()` function for key/value-specific filtering
- Enhanced `getNextSearchScope()` and `getSearchScopeDisplayName()` utilities
- Comprehensive test coverage with 39 new tests

## Test Coverage

- **searchUtils.test.ts**: 34 tests covering all search functionality
- **search.test.ts**: 5 tests for type definitions and interfaces
- All existing tests continue to pass (296 total tests)
- Full TypeScript type safety and lint compliance

## Usage

1. Press `s` to start search
2. Type search term
3. Press `Tab` to cycle through search scopes
4. Press `Enter` to execute search
5. Use `n`/`N` to navigate through results

## Backward Compatibility

- All existing search functionality remains unchanged
- Default search scope is "all" (existing behavior)
- No breaking changes to existing APIs or user workflows
